##

CVE-2024-1708
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-22T15:19:39.123000

42 posts

ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems.

1 repos

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/ScreenConnect-AuthBypass-RCE

H3liumb0y at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.983Z ##

"ð¨ ScreenConnect Exploits Unleash ToddleShark Malware by Kimsuky ð¨"

Kimsuky, the North Korean APT, leverages vulnerabilities in ScreenConnect (CVE-2024-1708 & CVE-2024-1709) to deploy ToddleShark, aiming at espionage. This polymorphic malware uses Microsoft binaries for stealth and conducts extensive data theft. It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

#CyberSecurity #APT #NorthKorea #Malware #ScreenConnect #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #ToddleShark #Kimsuky #DataTheft #Espionage #InfoSec

Source: BleepingComputer.com

Mitre - Kimsuky

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-02-22T08:28:34.111Z ##

"ð¨ Critical Vulnerabilities Alert in ConnectWise Software ð¨"

Two vulnerabilities have been identified in ConnectWise's remote desktop software, ScreenConnect, affecting versions 23.9.7 and prior. The first vulnerability (CVE-2024-1708) is a path-traversal issue allowing potential remote code execution or access to sensitive data, rated with a high severity score of 8.4.

The second (CVE-2024-1709) is an authentication bypass, considered critical with a severity score of 10.0, and is easily exploitable with existing proof-of-concept exploits. ConnectWise has issued updates for cloud-hosted instances, but self-hosted deployments need immediate patching. The exposure is global, with significant concentrations in the United States, and it's expected that cybercriminals and nation-state actors will actively exploit these vulnerabilities.

| ---- | ---- | ---- |
| CVE Number | Description | *CVSS Severity* |
| CVE-2024-1708 | ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by a path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems. | 8.4 High |
| CVE-2024-1709 | ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by an authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel vulnerability, which may allow an attacker direct access to confidential information or critical systems. | 10.0 Critical |

Professionals using ConnectWise must urgently patch their systems to mitigate these vulnerabilities. The discovery underscores the importance of rigorous security practices in protecting IT infrastructures.

ð¡ï¸ð»ð

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #ConnectWise #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #PatchManagement #ITSecurity #RemoteCodeExecution #PrivilegeEscalation

Source: Unit42 by Palo Alto Networks

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.000Z ##

"ð¨ ScreenConnect Exploits Unleash ToddleShark Malware by Kimsuky ð¨"

Kimsuky, the North Korean APT, leverages vulnerabilities in ScreenConnect (CVE-2024-1708 & CVE-2024-1709) to deploy ToddleShark, aiming at espionage. This polymorphic malware uses Microsoft binaries for stealth and conducts extensive data theft. It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

#CyberSecurity #APT #NorthKorea #Malware #ScreenConnect #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #ToddleShark #Kimsuky #DataTheft #Espionage #InfoSec

Source: BleepingComputer.com

Mitre - Kimsuky

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-22T08:28:34.000Z ##

"ð¨ Critical Vulnerabilities Alert in ConnectWise Software ð¨"

Two vulnerabilities have been identified in ConnectWise's remote desktop software, ScreenConnect, affecting versions 23.9.7 and prior. The first vulnerability (CVE-2024-1708) is a path-traversal issue allowing potential remote code execution or access to sensitive data, rated with a high severity score of 8.4.

The second (CVE-2024-1709) is an authentication bypass, considered critical with a severity score of 10.0, and is easily exploitable with existing proof-of-concept exploits. ConnectWise has issued updates for cloud-hosted instances, but self-hosted deployments need immediate patching. The exposure is global, with significant concentrations in the United States, and it's expected that cybercriminals and nation-state actors will actively exploit these vulnerabilities.

| ---- | ---- | ---- |
| CVE Number | Description | *CVSS Severity* |
| CVE-2024-1708 | ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by a path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems. | 8.4 High |
| CVE-2024-1709 | ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by an authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel vulnerability, which may allow an attacker direct access to confidential information or critical systems. | 10.0 Critical |

Professionals using ConnectWise must urgently patch their systems to mitigate these vulnerabilities. The discovery underscores the importance of rigorous security practices in protecting IT infrastructures.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-24T13:46:44.076Z ##

Mandiant updated their remediation and hardening guide for responding to the ConnectWise ScreenConnect vunerabilities CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708. This 19 page report contains proactive preparation and hardening actions, containment and initial investigative steps, remediation steps, and additional hardening measures.
ð https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/connectwise-screenconnect-hardening-remediation

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #vulnerability #RCE #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_1709 #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #IOC #CVE_2024_1708

##
simontsui at 2024-02-23T20:29:34.910Z ##

Huntress covers mass exploitation of ScreenConnect vulnerabilities CVE-2024-1709 (and CVE-2024-1708? maybe) in the wild. This includes everything from additional payloads, additional remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools, to cryptominers and Lockbit (variant) ransomware. IOC provided.
ð https://www.huntress.com/blog/slashandgrab-screen-connect-post-exploitation-in-the-wild-cve-2024-1709-cve-2024-1708

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #threatintel #buhtiRansom #Lockbit #ransomware #AsyncRAT #infostealer #Vidar #Redline #CobaltStrike #Xworm #SimpleHelp #cryptransomware #cybercrime

##
simontsui at 2024-02-23T14:55:59.726Z ##

Sophos covers attacks involving the new ConnectWise ScreenConnect vulnerabilities. This includes a Lockbit ransomware variant (buhtiRansom) using the leaked builder tool in 2023. Other attacks involved dropping AsyncRAT, Rust infostealer, and Vidar/Redline stealer. One attack dropped another remote access client called SimpleHelp, followed up by CRYPT ransomware. There were also Cobalt Strike and Xworm payloads. Sophos provides threat hunting information. No IOC.
ð https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/02/23/connectwise-screenconnect-attacks-deliver-malware/

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #threatintel #buhtiRansom #Lockbit #ransomware #AsyncRAT #infostealer #Vidar #Redline #CobaltStrike #Xworm #SimpleHelp #cryptransomware #cybercrime

##
simontsui at 2024-02-21T15:43:15.079Z ##

@wdormann @briankrebs @GossiTheDog @campuscodi HOT OFF THE PRESS!
CISA assigned CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 to the actively exploited ConnectWise ScreenConnect RCE vulnerabilities:

  • https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1709
  • https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1708

simontsui at 2024-02-21T13:43:01.078Z ##

Just in case anyone is stumbling across this conversation now, the security advisory has been updated 20 February 2024 that it was being exploited in the wild. ConnectWise provided indicators of compromise: https://www.connectwise.com/company/trust/security-bulletins/connectwise-screenconnect-23.9.8

CISA assigned CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 to the actively exploited ConnectWise ScreenConnect RCE vulnerabilities

CISA assigned CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 to the actively exploited ConnectWise ScreenConnect RCE vulnerabilities:

  • https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1709
  • https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1708

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #vulnerability #RCE #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #IOC

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-21T13:43:01.000Z ##

Just in case anyone is stumbling across this conversation now, the security advisory has been updated 20 February 2024 that it was being exploited in the wild. ConnectWise provided indicators of compromise: https://www.connectwise.com/company/trust/security-bulletins/connectwise-screenconnect-23.9.8

CISA assigned CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 to the actively exploited ConnectWise ScreenConnect RCE vulnerabilities

#eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #ConnectWise #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #ScreenConnect

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.983Z ##

"ð¨ ScreenConnect Exploits Unleash ToddleShark Malware by Kimsuky ð¨"

Kimsuky, the North Korean APT, leverages vulnerabilities in ScreenConnect (CVE-2024-1708 & CVE-2024-1709) to deploy ToddleShark, aiming at espionage. This polymorphic malware uses Microsoft binaries for stealth and conducts extensive data theft. It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

#CyberSecurity #APT #NorthKorea #Malware #ScreenConnect #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #ToddleShark #Kimsuky #DataTheft #Espionage #InfoSec

Source: BleepingComputer.com

Mitre - Kimsuky

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-02-22T08:28:34.111Z ##

"ð¨ Critical Vulnerabilities Alert in ConnectWise Software ð¨"

Two vulnerabilities have been identified in ConnectWise's remote desktop software, ScreenConnect, affecting versions 23.9.7 and prior. The first vulnerability (CVE-2024-1708) is a path-traversal issue allowing potential remote code execution or access to sensitive data, rated with a high severity score of 8.4.

The second (CVE-2024-1709) is an authentication bypass, considered critical with a severity score of 10.0, and is easily exploitable with existing proof-of-concept exploits. ConnectWise has issued updates for cloud-hosted instances, but self-hosted deployments need immediate patching. The exposure is global, with significant concentrations in the United States, and it's expected that cybercriminals and nation-state actors will actively exploit these vulnerabilities.

| ---- | ---- | ---- |
| CVE Number | Description | *CVSS Severity* |
| CVE-2024-1708 | ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by a path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems. | 8.4 High |
| CVE-2024-1709 | ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by an authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel vulnerability, which may allow an attacker direct access to confidential information or critical systems. | 10.0 Critical |

Professionals using ConnectWise must urgently patch their systems to mitigate these vulnerabilities. The discovery underscores the importance of rigorous security practices in protecting IT infrastructures.

ð¡ï¸ð»ð

Tags: #CyberSecurity #VulnerabilityAlert #ConnectWise #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #PatchManagement #ITSecurity #RemoteCodeExecution #PrivilegeEscalation

Source: Unit42 by Palo Alto Networks

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.000Z ##

"ð¨ ScreenConnect Exploits Unleash ToddleShark Malware by Kimsuky ð¨"

Kimsuky, the North Korean APT, leverages vulnerabilities in ScreenConnect (CVE-2024-1708 & CVE-2024-1709) to deploy ToddleShark, aiming at espionage. This polymorphic malware uses Microsoft binaries for stealth and conducts extensive data theft. It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

#CyberSecurity #APT #NorthKorea #Malware #ScreenConnect #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #ToddleShark #Kimsuky #DataTheft #Espionage #InfoSec

Source: BleepingComputer.com

Mitre - Kimsuky

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-22T08:28:34.000Z ##

"ð¨ Critical Vulnerabilities Alert in ConnectWise Software ð¨"

Two vulnerabilities have been identified in ConnectWise's remote desktop software, ScreenConnect, affecting versions 23.9.7 and prior. The first vulnerability (CVE-2024-1708) is a path-traversal issue allowing potential remote code execution or access to sensitive data, rated with a high severity score of 8.4.

The second (CVE-2024-1709) is an authentication bypass, considered critical with a severity score of 10.0, and is easily exploitable with existing proof-of-concept exploits. ConnectWise has issued updates for cloud-hosted instances, but self-hosted deployments need immediate patching. The exposure is global, with significant concentrations in the United States, and it's expected that cybercriminals and nation-state actors will actively exploit these vulnerabilities.

| ---- | ---- | ---- |
| CVE Number | Description | *CVSS Severity* |
| CVE-2024-1708 | ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by a path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems. | 8.4 High |
| CVE-2024-1709 | ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by an authentication bypass using an alternate path or channel vulnerability, which may allow an attacker direct access to confidential information or critical systems. | 10.0 Critical |

Professionals using ConnectWise must urgently patch their systems to mitigate these vulnerabilities. The discovery underscores the importance of rigorous security practices in protecting IT infrastructures.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-24T13:46:44.076Z ##

Mandiant updated their remediation and hardening guide for responding to the ConnectWise ScreenConnect vunerabilities CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708. This 19 page report contains proactive preparation and hardening actions, containment and initial investigative steps, remediation steps, and additional hardening measures.
ð https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/connectwise-screenconnect-hardening-remediation

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #vulnerability #RCE #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_1709 #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #IOC #CVE_2024_1708

##
simontsui at 2024-02-23T20:29:34.910Z ##

Huntress covers mass exploitation of ScreenConnect vulnerabilities CVE-2024-1709 (and CVE-2024-1708? maybe) in the wild. This includes everything from additional payloads, additional remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools, to cryptominers and Lockbit (variant) ransomware. IOC provided.
ð https://www.huntress.com/blog/slashandgrab-screen-connect-post-exploitation-in-the-wild-cve-2024-1709-cve-2024-1708

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #threatintel #buhtiRansom #Lockbit #ransomware #AsyncRAT #infostealer #Vidar #Redline #CobaltStrike #Xworm #SimpleHelp #cryptransomware #cybercrime

##
simontsui at 2024-02-23T14:55:59.726Z ##

Sophos covers attacks involving the new ConnectWise ScreenConnect vulnerabilities. This includes a Lockbit ransomware variant (buhtiRansom) using the leaked builder tool in 2023. Other attacks involved dropping AsyncRAT, Rust infostealer, and Vidar/Redline stealer. One attack dropped another remote access client called SimpleHelp, followed up by CRYPT ransomware. There were also Cobalt Strike and Xworm payloads. Sophos provides threat hunting information. No IOC.
ð https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/02/23/connectwise-screenconnect-attacks-deliver-malware/

#ConnectWise #ScreenConnect #CVE_2024_1709 #CVE_2024_1708 #threatintel #buhtiRansom #Lockbit #ransomware #AsyncRAT #infostealer #Vidar #Redline #CobaltStrike #Xworm #SimpleHelp #cryptransomware #cybercrime

pentesttools at 2024-02-28T12:55:44.075Z ##

ð¨ Just launched: FREE scanner for #SlashAndGrab ð¥·, the ConnectWise ScreenConnect vulnerabilities: https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/connectwise-screenconnect-cve-2024-1709-vulnerability-scanner

ð Here are the specs:

When John Hammond started posting about CVE-2024-1709 (CVSSv3 10) & CVE-2024-1708 (CVSSv3 8.4), we instantly picked up on them.

Our team moved fast and added detection for both CVEs, knowing attackers are actively trying to use them (CVE-2024-1709 especially) to bypass security controls and gain unrestricted system access.

We also turned it into a FREE tool for any pentester to use: https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/connectwise-screenconnect-cve-2024-1709-vulnerability-scanner

##
todb at 2024-02-28T03:12:55.239Z ##

@austinlarsen @simontsui nbd, you're not the only one.

I'm still on the (now somewhat passive) hunt for any real evidence of exploitation for the other one. Lots of conjecture, loads of hits for CVE-2024-1709, but nothing solid for CVE-2024-1708. Every news outlet seems to just conflate the two and sometimes gets them backwards.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-27T12:45:28.527Z ##

@campuscodi one question I have is, do they even need to exploit CVE-2024-1708? With CVE-2024-1709, they create an admin user on the ScreenConnect server, giving them full control. This is a one character cheat, whereas 1708 requires user interaction and privileges (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H)

I don't specifically see it in the Trend Micro article, but is there actual evidence of CVE-2024-1708 exploitation? Since unpatched versions of ScreenConnect are vulnerable to both 1708 and 1709, it's almost certainly going to make 1709 the more valuable exploit.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-02-27T12:34:44.000Z ##

simontsui at 2024-02-22T01:41:26.523Z ##

Unit 42 posts a late night warning about ConnectWise ScreenConnect Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709. Waiting out the commotion of the past 12 hours certainly helped. They cover the main talking points of these vulnerabilities' severity, being trivially exploitable, the existence of proofs of concept, active exploitation, and indicators of compromise. Oh and they include CVE IDs, which many publications today did not update their articles with.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-21T20:11:02.709Z ##

@rallias @mttaggart likely referring to ConnectWise ScreenConnect remote code execution vulnerabilities. They were disclosed without CVE IDs on 19 February 2024.

According to CVE.org records, Cybersecurity And Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) U.S. Civilian Government assigned CVE-2024-1708 (8.4 high) to the path traversal vulnerability and CVE-2024-1709 (10.0 critical) to the authentication bypass vulnerability.

  • Security advisory: https://www.connectwise.com/company/trust/security-bulletins/connectwise-screenconnect-23.9.8
  • CVE.org https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1708
  • CVE.org https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-1709
  • Technical analyses: https://www.huntress.com/blog/a-catastrophe-for-control-understanding-the-screenconnect-authentication-bypass
  • Proof of Concept: https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/connectwise-screenconnect_auth-bypass-add-user-poc
  • Proof of Concept 2: https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/red-team/connectwise-screenconnect-auth-bypass-deep-dive/

When John Hammond started posting about CVE-2024-1709 (CVSSv3 10) & CVE-2024-1708 (CVSSv3 8.4), we instantly picked up on them.

CVE-2023-33012
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2023-11-05T05:02:51

1 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the configuration parser of the Zyxel ATP series firmware versions 5.10 through 5.36 Patch 2, USG FLEX series firmware versions 5.00 through 5.36 Patch 2, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions 5.10 through 5.36 Patch 2, USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions 5.10 through 5.36 Patch 2, and VPN series firmware versions 5.00 through 5.36 Patch 2,Â could allow an

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-02-22T14:02:39.000Z ##

VulnCheck's Jacob Baines has discovered that a recent vulnerability disclosed in Zyxel firewalls by SSD researchers is actually an older bug tracked as CVE-2023-33012.

"The associated disclosure did not mention any caveats to exploitation, but it turns out only an uncommon configuration is affected. There are currently about 600 internet-facing Zyxel firewalls vulnerable to this issue (out of ~26,000)."

There is no evidence of exploitation in the wild.

https://vulncheck.com/blog/zyxel-cve-2023-33012

##

CVE-2024-20321
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-29T03:33:26

4 posts

A vulnerability in the External Border Gateway Protocol (eBGP) implementation of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because eBGP traffic is mapped to a shared hardware rate-limiter queue. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending large amounts of network t

jbhall56 at 2024-02-29T13:52:49.297Z ##

The first of the high-severity bugs, CVE-2024-20321, exists because External Border Gateway Protocol (eBGP) traffic âis mapped to a shared hardware rate-limiter queueâ, allowing an unauthenticated, remote attacker to send large amounts of traffic and cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. https://www.securityweek.com/cisco-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-data-center-os/

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T16:23:18.177Z ##

Cisco dropped several security advisories for FXOS and NX-OS Software, Nexus switches, and UCS:

  • CVE-2024-20321 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software External Border Gateway Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20294 (6.4 medium) Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Software Link Layer Discovery Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20291 (5.8 medium) Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches Port Channel ACL Programming Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20344 (5.3 medium) Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects Intersight Managed Mode Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20267 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software MPLS Encapsulated IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory

##

CVE-2024-20267
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-29T03:33:26

2 posts

A vulnerability with the handling of MPLS traffic for Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the netstack process to unexpectedly restart, which could cause the device to stop processing network traffic or to reload. This vulnerability is due to lack of proper error checking when processing an ingress MPLS frame. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabilit

simontsui at 2024-02-28T16:23:18.177Z ##

Cisco dropped several security advisories for FXOS and NX-OS Software, Nexus switches, and UCS:

  • CVE-2024-20321 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software External Border Gateway Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20294 (6.4 medium) Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Software Link Layer Discovery Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20291 (5.8 medium) Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches Port Channel ACL Programming Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20344 (5.3 medium) Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects Intersight Managed Mode Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20267 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software MPLS Encapsulated IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-28T16:23:18.000Z ##

Cisco dropped several security advisories for FXOS and NX-OS Software, Nexus switches, and UCS:

  • CVE-2024-20321 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software External Border Gateway Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20294 (6.4 medium) Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Software Link Layer Discovery Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20291 (5.8 medium) Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches Port Channel ACL Programming Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20344 (5.3 medium) Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects Intersight Managed Mode Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20267 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software MPLS Encapsulated IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory

##

CVE-2024-21423
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-24T00:30:26

1 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-02-23T21:52:47.414Z ##

MSRC (Microsoft) released 11 Chromium-related security advisories. The ones not already included in Google's original post are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-21423 (4.8 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26188 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26192 (8.2 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

The Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section of each vulnerability explains a lot more than Google normally would. Also provides a CVSSv3 score. These are noted as Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely (CVE-2024-26192 is missing an exploitability assessment).

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chrome #Chromium

##

CVE-2024-26188
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-24T00:30:26

1 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-02-23T21:52:47.414Z ##

MSRC (Microsoft) released 11 Chromium-related security advisories. The ones not already included in Google's original post are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-21423 (4.8 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26188 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26192 (8.2 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

The Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section of each vulnerability explains a lot more than Google normally would. Also provides a CVSSv3 score. These are noted as Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely (CVE-2024-26192 is missing an exploitability assessment).

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chrome #Chromium

##

CVE-2024-1212
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-21T18:31:06

1 posts

Unauthenticated remote attackers can access the system through the LoadMaster management interface, enabling arbitrary system command execution.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-02-22T13:30:55.000Z ##

Kemp Technologies has published a security update for its LoadMaster load balancer appliance.

The update fixes a critical security flaw that allows threat actors to access the device's management interface. Kemp says attackers can take over devices via malicious API commands. No authentication required.

The vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2024-1212. (cc @simontsui)

https://support.kemptechnologies.com/hc/en-us/articles/23878931058445-LoadMaster-Security-Vulnerability-CVE-2024-1212

##

CVE-2024-26592(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-23T09:30:39

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd: fix UAF issue in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() The race is between the handling of a new TCP connection and its disconnection. It leads to UAF on `struct tcp_transport` in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() function.

sambowne at 2024-02-27T23:26:44.055Z ##

CVE-2024-26592 & 26594: Critical Linux Kernel Flaws Open Door for Code Execution and Data Theft https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-26592-26594-critical-linux-kernel-flaws-open-door-for-code-execution-and-data-theft/

##

CVE-2023-52472(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-26T18:30:29

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: crypto: rsa - add a check for allocation failure Static checkers insist that the mpi_alloc() allocation can fail so add a check to prevent a NULL dereference. Small allocations like this can't actually fail in current kernels, but adding a check is very simple and makes the static checkers happy.

vegard@mastodon.social at 2024-02-25T21:07:45.000Z ##

I'm really not sure what to think of this.

edit: https://lore.kernel.org/all/2024022547-CVE-2023-52472-fa03@gregkh/

##

CVE-2024-26196
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-02-29T20:41:08.929Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) released three Chromium related security advisories. The new advisory is CVE-2024-26196 (4.3 medium, not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely) Microsoft Edge for Android (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability. In the Frequently Asked Questions, it's revealed that the user would have to click on a specially crafted URL to be compromised by the attacker. The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is client_secret token for a push notification service in Edge android. The other two vulnerabilities were originally disclosed on 27 February 2024 in Google Chrome's security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_26196 #Android #Edge #Chromium

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-29T20:41:08.000Z ##

The new advisory is CVE-2024-26196 (4.3 medium, not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely) Microsoft Edge for Android (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability. The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is client_secret token for a push notification service in Edge android. The other two vulnerabilities were originally disclosed on 27 February 2024 in Google Chrome's security advisory.

##

CVE-2024-27198
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-04T18:30:47

39 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 authentication bypass allowing to perform admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

4 repos

https://github.com/labesterOct/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2024-27198

decio at 2024-03-06T05:39:59.858Z ##

âRapid7 throws JetBrains under the bus for 'uncoordinated vulnerability disclosure'
Exploits began within hours of the original disclosure, so patch nowâ
ð
https://www.theregister.com/2024/03/05/rapid7_jetbrains_vuln_disclosure_dispute/

#CyberVeille #jetbrains #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #disclosure

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T23:10:54.299Z ##

Computer Weekly takes interest in the JetBrains-Rapid7 feud. "At the core of the disagreement lies a difference in approaches to vulnerability disclosure and patching." They neglected to mention JetBrains's explicitly stating "At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7"
ð https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

Shoutout to @todb who was quoted from a 2022 Rapid7 blog post:

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:42:41.230Z ##

Why you should care about the new JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical):

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA published a cybersecurity advisory reporting that the Russian state-sponsored APT29 (Cozy Bear, publicly attributed to Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the USG) was mass-exploiting CVE-2023-42793 since September 2023.
  • From public disclosure to proof of concept was 6 days. Exploitation was within 7 days after that (KEV Catalog in 15 days). Nation-state abuse within 12-22 days of public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:11:10.900Z ##

JetBrains tries to save face by responding to Rapid7's blog post with clarifications. It comes off accusatory and defends their attempt to silently patch. cc: @catc0n @campuscodi @serghei @jgreig
ð https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

To reiterate, we never had any intention to release a fix silently without making the full details public. As a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), we assigned CVE IDs for both issues a day after receiving the report.

We suggested disclosing the details of the vulnerabilities in the same way we have followed in the past (with a time delay between releasing a fix and making a full disclosure), which allows our customers to upgrade their TeamCity instances.

This suggestion was rejected by the Rapid7 team who published full details of the vulnerabilities (and how to exploit them) a few hours after we had released a fix to TeamCity customers.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T13:44:21.638Z ##

@jwarminsky @jgreig ShadowServer is seeing exploitation activity for CVE-2024-27198 since yesterday evening (2200 UTC) with at least 16 IPs scanning. It is likely to be added to CISA's KEV Catalog at this rate.
ð https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112042621949812462

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
StaceyHolleran at 2024-03-04T19:42:16.187Z ##

Rapid7 has disclosed 2 authentication bypass vulnerabilities, #CVE_2024_27198 and #CVE_2024_27199 affecting JetBrains TeamCity CI/CD server. The most severe of which allows for unauthenticated RCE. https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T19:33:44.520Z ##

Rapid7 provides technical analyses into JetBrains TeamCity vulnerabilities CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27199, both of which they consider to be authentication bypasses. They provide what are effectively Proofs of Concept, even if the words "poc" or "proof" aren't used. Rapid7 notes what an indicator of compromise would appear as for CVE-2024-27198. Timeline has an interesting exchange between JetBrains and Rapid7 regarding silent patching.
ð https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

cc: @ntkramer @catc0n

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T18:20:23.468Z ##

JetBrains security advisory affecting TeamCity. No mention of exploitation in the wild (yet).

  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered critical severity) Authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered high severity) Path traversal

ð https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/

Why you should care: A TeamCity vulnerability was previously exploited by Russian state-sponsored APT29 as an N-day following public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199

ð https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.

##
iagox86 at 2024-03-05T21:01:48.543Z ##

If you read between the lines on the JetBrains and Rapid7 story, you'll see that JetBrains decided to cut Rapid7 out of the loop on Feb 23, but told Rapid7 that they're "still investigating" on Mar 1.

However you feel about PoCs, technical details, disclosure, etc., it's super inappropriate to lie to researchers who disclosed this to you responsibly about what your plans are.

Refs:

  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

ntkramer at 2024-03-04T18:06:06.305Z ##

zeljkazorz at 2024-03-04T16:12:51.875Z ##

JetBrains has fixed two critical security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-27198, CVE-2024-27199) affecting TeamCity On-Premises and is urging customers to patch them immediately as the release of technical details is imminent.

##
stk@mountains.social at 2024-03-04T14:53:17.000Z ##

Jetbrains just released an urgent security advisory for on prem teamcity installations. Admin access by auth bypass. Time for an immediate update, I guess.

https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/

##
iagox86@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T21:01:48.000Z ##

If you read between the lines on the JetBrains and Rapid7 story, you'll see that JetBrains decided to cut Rapid7 out of the loop on Feb 23, but told Rapid7 that they're "still investigating" on Mar 1.

However you feel about PoCs, technical details, disclosure, etc., it's super inappropriate to lie to researchers who disclosed this to you responsibly about what your plans are.

Refs:

  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/
##
ntkramer@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T16:57:30.000Z ##

â¡ï¸ & #threatintel: to no one's surprise, we are already observing IPs attempting to exploit an authentication bypass in JetBrains' TeamCity (CVE-2024-27198) following yesterday's POC release.

https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/teamcity-jetbrain-cve-2024-27198-auth-bypass-attempt?days=1

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T14:04:57.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-27198 (CVSS score of 9.8) and CVE-2024-27199 (CVSS score of 7.3), the security defects impact the web component of TeamCity and exist because of an alternative path and a path traversal issue, respectively. https://www.securityweek.com/critical-vulnerability-exposes-teamcity-servers-to-takeover/

##

CVE-2024-27199
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-04T18:30:47

36 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 path traversal allowing to perform limited admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

decio at 2024-03-06T05:39:59.858Z ##

âRapid7 throws JetBrains under the bus for 'uncoordinated vulnerability disclosure'
Exploits began within hours of the original disclosure, so patch nowâ
ð
https://www.theregister.com/2024/03/05/rapid7_jetbrains_vuln_disclosure_dispute/

#CyberVeille #jetbrains #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #disclosure

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T23:10:54.299Z ##

Computer Weekly takes interest in the JetBrains-Rapid7 feud. "At the core of the disagreement lies a difference in approaches to vulnerability disclosure and patching." They neglected to mention JetBrains's explicitly stating "At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7"
ð https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

Shoutout to @todb who was quoted from a 2022 Rapid7 blog post:

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:42:41.230Z ##

Why you should care about the new JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical):

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA published a cybersecurity advisory reporting that the Russian state-sponsored APT29 (Cozy Bear, publicly attributed to Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the USG) was mass-exploiting CVE-2023-42793 since September 2023.
  • From public disclosure to proof of concept was 6 days. Exploitation was within 7 days after that (KEV Catalog in 15 days). Nation-state abuse within 12-22 days of public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:11:10.900Z ##

JetBrains tries to save face by responding to Rapid7's blog post with clarifications. It comes off accusatory and defends their attempt to silently patch. cc: @catc0n @campuscodi @serghei @jgreig
ð https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

To reiterate, we never had any intention to release a fix silently without making the full details public. As a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), we assigned CVE IDs for both issues a day after receiving the report.

We suggested disclosing the details of the vulnerabilities in the same way we have followed in the past (with a time delay between releasing a fix and making a full disclosure), which allows our customers to upgrade their TeamCity instances.

This suggestion was rejected by the Rapid7 team who published full details of the vulnerabilities (and how to exploit them) a few hours after we had released a fix to TeamCity customers.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T13:44:21.638Z ##

@jwarminsky @jgreig ShadowServer is seeing exploitation activity for CVE-2024-27198 since yesterday evening (2200 UTC) with at least 16 IPs scanning. It is likely to be added to CISA's KEV Catalog at this rate.
ð https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112042621949812462

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
StaceyHolleran at 2024-03-04T19:42:16.187Z ##

Rapid7 has disclosed 2 authentication bypass vulnerabilities, #CVE_2024_27198 and #CVE_2024_27199 affecting JetBrains TeamCity CI/CD server. The most severe of which allows for unauthenticated RCE. https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T19:33:44.520Z ##

Rapid7 provides technical analyses into JetBrains TeamCity vulnerabilities CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27199, both of which they consider to be authentication bypasses. They provide what are effectively Proofs of Concept, even if the words "poc" or "proof" aren't used. Rapid7 notes what an indicator of compromise would appear as for CVE-2024-27198. Timeline has an interesting exchange between JetBrains and Rapid7 regarding silent patching.
ð https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

cc: @ntkramer @catc0n

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T18:20:23.468Z ##

JetBrains security advisory affecting TeamCity. No mention of exploitation in the wild (yet).

  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered critical severity) Authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered high severity) Path traversal

ð https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/

Why you should care: A TeamCity vulnerability was previously exploited by Russian state-sponsored APT29 as an N-day following public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T23:10:54.000Z ##

Computer Weekly takes interest in the JetBrains-Rapid7 feud. "At the core of the disagreement lies a difference in approaches to vulnerability disclosure and patching." They neglected to mention JetBrains's explicitly stating "At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7"
ð https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

Shoutout to @todb who was quoted from a 2022 Rapid7 blog post:

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T16:42:41.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical):

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA published a cybersecurity advisory reporting that the Russian state-sponsored APT29 (Cozy Bear, publicly attributed to Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the USG) was mass-exploiting CVE-2023-42793 since September 2023.
  • From public disclosure to proof of concept was 6 days. Exploitation was within 7 days after that (KEV Catalog in 15 days). Nation-state abuse within 12-22 days of public disclosure.

ð https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

##
iagox86 at 2024-03-05T21:01:48.543Z ##

If you read between the lines on the JetBrains and Rapid7 story, you'll see that JetBrains decided to cut Rapid7 out of the loop on Feb 23, but told Rapid7 that they're "still investigating" on Mar 1.

However you feel about PoCs, technical details, disclosure, etc., it's super inappropriate to lie to researchers who disclosed this to you responsibly about what your plans are.

Refs:

  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-05T00:31:22

2 posts

The encrypted subject of an email message could be incorrectly and permanently assigned to an arbitrary other email message in Thunderbird's local cache. Consequently, when replying to the contaminated email message, the user might accidentally leak the confidential subject to a third party. simontsui at 2024-02-28T16:23:18.177Z ##

Cisco dropped several security advisories for FXOS and NX-OS Software, Nexus switches, and UCS:

  • CVE-2024-20321 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software External Border Gateway Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20294 (6.4 medium) Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Software Link Layer Discovery Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20291 (5.8 medium) Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches Port Channel ACL Programming Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20344 (5.3 medium) Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects Intersight Managed Mode Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20267 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software MPLS Encapsulated IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

VMware security advisory: CVE-2024-22251 (5.9 medium) VMware Workstation and Fusion contain an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the USB CCID (chip card interface device). A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may trigger an out-of-bounds read leading to information disclosure. Fixed in Workstation 17.5.1 and Fusion 13.5.1. No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-20325
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-21T18:31:05

1 posts

A vulnerability in the Live Data server of Cisco Unified Intelligence Center could allow an unauthenticated, local attacker to read and modify data in a repository that belongs to an internal service on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient access control implementations on cluster configuration CLI requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a clust

simontsui at 2024-02-21T16:21:43.146Z ##

Cisco published a security advisory: CVE-2024-20325 (5.1 medium) Cisco Unified Intelligence Center Insufficient Access Control Vulnerability. Not exploited.

A vulnerability in the Live Data server of Cisco Unified Intelligence Center could allow an unauthenticated, local attacker to read and modify data in a repository that belongs to an internal service on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient access control implementations on cluster configuration CLI requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a cluster configuration CLI request to specific directories on an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to read and modify data that is handled by an internal service on the affected device.

ð https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cuic-access-control-jJsZQMjj

#Cisco #CVE_2024_20325 #CiscoUnifiedIntelligenceCenter #accesscontrol #vulnerability

CVE-2024-21378
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-13T18:38:31

2 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-03-05T23:46:31.945Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) updated CVE-2024-21378 (now scoring 8.8 high severity, disclosed 13 February 2024) Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. From what I can tell, they changed User Interaction to None, which raised the CVSSv3 score from 8.0 to 8.8. The FAQ section was updated but doesn't mention user interaction. Just FYI, the vulnerability submitter NetSPI intends to release vulnerability details about CVE-2024-21378 on 11 March 2024.
ð https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21378

#Microsoft #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #RCE

updated 2024-03-06T03:30:28

User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-13Android ID: A-251586912

simontsui at 2024-03-05T18:47:57.860Z ##

In tracking the origins of exploitation leading up to their KEV Catalog additions:

  • I previously informed the CISA Vulnerability Management Team of potential exploitation of CVE-2021-36380 as part of an IZ1H9 Mirai-based DDoS campaign reported by Fortinet on 09 October 2023. What they do with that information is up to them.
  • The Pixel Update Bulletin published 13 June 2023 included an announcement that read "Note: There are indications that CVE-2023-21237 may be under limited, targeted exploitation."

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2023_21237 #CVE_2021_36380

ð https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2024-0006.html

  • CVE-2024-22254 (7.9 high) ESXi Out-of-bounds write vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-22253
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-03-05T18:31:19

6 posts

VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the UHCI USB controller.Â A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host. On ESXi, the exploitation is contained within the VMX sandbox whereas, on Workstation and Fusion, this may lead to code exe

##

CVE-2024-23225(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-03-05T21:30:31

9 posts

A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An attacker with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass kernel memory protections. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-03-05T21:40:07.000Z ##

Apple Blunts Zero-Day Attacks With iOS 17.4 Update https://www.securityweek.com/apple-blunts-zero-day-attacks-with-ios-17-4-update/ #Mobile&Wireless #Vulnerabilities #CVE202423225 #CVE202423296 #ZeroDay #IOS174

simontsui at 2024-03-05T19:46:11.555Z ##

@jullrich of SANS ISC beats the other infosec publications to the punch by reporting on the Apple zero-days CVE-2024-23225 and CVE-2024-23296 first.
ð https://isc.sans.edu/diary/rss/30716

#Apple #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_23225 #CVE_2024_23296

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T18:50:41.105Z ##

Apple zero-days:

  • CVE-2024-23225: memory corruption in Kernel allowed for bypassing kernel memory protections
  • CVE-2024-23296: memory corruption in RTKit allowed for bypassing kernel memory protections

Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

cc: @serghei @campuscodi @briankrebs @GossiTheDog @mttaggart

ð https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214081 https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214082

##

CVE-2024-23243(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-03-05T21:30:31

2 posts

A privacy issue was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An app may be able to read sensitive location information.

simontsui at 2024-03-05T19:18:36.763Z ##

@campuscodi Apple put that information all over this security advisory, making it hard to decipher. It's an AirDrop vulnerability in Accessibility, that could allow an app to read sensitive location information (labeled as privacy issue). CVE-2024-23243 (not exploited in the wild) was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. Cristian Dinca of "Tudor Vianu" National High School of Computer Science, Romania is credited for reporting this vulnerability, great job.

#Apple #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_23243

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T19:18:36.000Z ##

@campuscodi Apple put that information all over this security advisory, making it hard to decipher. It's an AirDrop vulnerability in Accessibility, that could allow an app to read sensitive location information (labeled as privacy issue). CVE-2024-23243 (not exploited in the wild) was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. Cristian Dinca of "Tudor Vianu" National High School of Computer Science, Romania is credited for reporting this vulnerability, great job.

#Apple #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_23243

##

CVE-2022-47016
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2023-02-04T05:06:33

1 posts

A null pointer dereference issue was discovered in function window_pane_set_event in window.c in tmux 3.0 thru 3.3 allows attackers to cause denial of service or other unspecified impacts.

rfr@tilde.zone at 2024-02-21T21:45:18.000Z ##

anecdotal, but a few months ago someone filed a bogus CVE against tmux (CVE-2022-47016), I was notified via the Debian security team. other distros started shipping a "fix" which actually turned a NULL-deref into a call to fatal(), i.e. no functional change. I challenged the CVE via some web form, and a few hours later someone wrote back saying that the CVE had been rejected. so the system worked for me, at leastâ¦

##
